intro: Veronica sublongifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved speedwell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and clusters of small blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Its foliage and flowers provide nectar for various pollinators, contributing to local biodiversity.
